conclusion: To determine the temperature at state D, we need to analyze the processes involved in the ABCDA cycle and use the ideal gas law: PV = nRT.
The ABCDA cycle consists of four processes: AB, BC, CD, and DA.
AB is an isobaric expansion from (P1, V1) to (P1, V2).
BC is an isochoric process from (P1, V2) to (P2, V2).
CD is an isobaric compression from (P2, V2) to (P2, V1).
DA is an isochoric process from (P2, V1) to (P1, V1).
State A temperature is given as T0.

premise: AB is isobaric. Use the ideal gas law: P1V1/T0 = P1V2/TB.
BC is isochoric. Use the ideal gas law: P1V2/TB = P2V2/TC.
CD is isobaric. Use the ideal gas law: P2V2/TC = P2V1/TD.
According to the ideal gas equation of state: (P1V1/T0) = (P1V2/TD).
